description: Bachelor’s degree* with at least 15 credit hours in cyber security, information assurance, or information technology; and three years of information technology experience, including two years of information security or information assurance experience**. Substitution: bachelor's degree candidates without at least 15 course credits in cyber security, information assurance, or information technology require an additional year of general information technology experience to qualify. Excellent oral and written communication skills including the ability to clearly articulate information technology and information security concepts to a varied audience to facilitate wide understanding. Demonstrated skill in facilitating meetings, listening, and negotiating between multiple stakeholders to drive results. Applicable information Security or specialized information technology certificate(s). The incumbent must be able to communicate clearly with subordinate staff regarding work priorities and performance. The incumbent will have to work with ITS teams and upper-level agency management to resolve technically complex and politically sensitive issues under pressure. Duties include, but are not limited to: Conduct detailed technical security reviews of systems and architecture. Identify risks in new and existing system design and architecture. Manage and resolve security threats to agency information systems. Serve as information security expert and evaluate systems and contracts for alignment with agency and State information security policies. Perform the full range of supervisory responsibilities.
